summary: This is a cover letter from Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorney Christian R. Everdell to Judge Alison J. Nathan, submitting a renewed bail motion and accompanying exhibits under seal in the case U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell. The letter indicates the documents are confidential and being sent in successive emails due to volume.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case (20 Cr. 330) for which a renewed bail motion is being submitted.

persons.name: Christian R Everdell
persons.context: Attorney from Cohen & Gresser LLP submitting the renewed bail motion and exhibits to Judge Nathan on behalf of Ghislaine Maxwell.

persons.name: Judge Nathan
persons.context: The judge presiding over U.S. v. Ghislaine Maxwell, to whom the bail motion documents are addressed and submitted.

connections.description: Everdell is submitting a renewed bail motion and exhibits on behalf of Maxwell, indicating he is her defense attorney.
Judge Nathan is the presiding judge in the criminal case against Maxwell.

events.title: Submission of Renewed Bail Motion
events.description: Defense attorney Christian R. Everdell submits a renewed bail motion and accompanying exhibits under seal to Judge Nathan in the Ghislaine Maxwell case.

keyFacts: A renewed bail motion for Ghislaine Maxwell was filed under seal on December 8, 2020.
The motion was submitted by defense attorney Christian R. Everdell of Cohen & Gresser LLP to Judge Alison J. Nathan.
The submission includes a cover letter, the unredacted bail motion, and five accompanying exhibits (A-E).
The documents were sent in successive emails due to their volume, indicating substantial supporting materials.
The communication emphasizes confidentiality, noting the information is privileged and intended only for the judge and counsel.
